ca.polymtl.inf3995.oronos.services

Class BroadcastMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.polymtl.inf3995.oronos.services.BroadcastMessage

  • public class BroadcastMessage
extends java.lang.Object

    Broadcast Message

    Indicates the fields of the messages going to any tag in need of can information. A Broadcast Message is created any time the client receive a UDP packet from the client containing can information.
    Since:
    2018-04-12
    Version:
    0.0
    Author:
    Patrick Richer St-Onge

    • Field Summary

      private java.lang.Number data2 
      private java.lang.Integer serialNb 
      private java.lang.String sourceModule 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BroadcastMessage()
      Constructor that should not be used as the Broadcast Message content can only be set on construction since the client should only display the information sent by the server.
      BroadcastMessage(java.lang.String canSid, java.lang.Number data1, java.lang.Number data2, java.lang.String sourceModule, java.lang.Integer serialNb, java.lang.Integer counter)
      Constructor that should be used so that the Broadcast Message is not empty.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BroadcastMessage

        BroadcastMessage()
        Constructor that should not be used as the Broadcast Message content can only be set on construction since the client should only display the information sent by the server.

      • BroadcastMessage

        BroadcastMessage(java.lang.String canSid,
                 java.lang.Number data1,
                 java.lang.Number data2,
                 java.lang.String sourceModule,
                 java.lang.Integer serialNb,
                 java.lang.Integer counter)
        Constructor that should be used so that the Broadcast Message is not empty.
        Parameters:
        canSid - the id name of a can message.
        data1 - the content of the first data field of a can message.
        data2 - the content of the second data field of a can message.
        sourceModule - the name of the module emitting the message.
        serialNb - the serial number of the sourceModule.
        counter - the n-message emitted by the sourceModule has counter == n.

    • Method Detail

      • getCanSid

        public java.lang.String getCanSid()
        Returns:
        canSid, the string representing the name id of a can message.

      • getData1

        public java.lang.Number getData1()
        Returns:
        the number contained in the first data field of the can message.

      • getData2

        public java.lang.Number getData2()
        Returns:
        the number contained in the second data field of the can message.

      • getSourceModule

        public java.lang.String getSourceModule()
        Returns:
        sourceModule, the string representing the name of the source module.

      • getSerialNb

        public java.lang.Integer getSerialNb()
        Returns:
        serialNb, the integer representing the serial number of the source module.

      • getCounter

        public java.lang.Integer getCounter()
        Returns:
        counter, the integer representing the n-message of the source module.
